column4: ﻿﻿My Ubuntu 8.04 box can't play music from the second life client (an app that plays sounds of its own as well as streaming media). I can play *sometimes* the same media url through vlc. And sometimes I can hear the test bleeps from the System -> Preferences -> Sound dialog. At the moment, I can hear the wind from sl, but no bleeps from the sound Dialog and no music, either from sl or from VLC. Looks like the mixing isn't happen
Try uninstalling PulseAudio so only Alsa runs
ubuntu-dekstop is just there to be dependent on all the ubuntu stuff. It itself has no other purpose
